instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only start in smc bypass
threads.message: so customer brought in this macbook, doesnt start with normal power button, but can turn on, in smc bypass, took out the logicboard, found that the trace cr5479 and <RESISTOR>R5479</RESISTOR> is gone, so i jumper it, because there are corrosion near smc, I has tried reballing smc, but still only start at smc bypass..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
What is the voltage at <CAPACITOR>C5479</CAPACITOR>?
Check traces continuity for <RESISTOR>R5477</RESISTOR>-79.
Also check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage.

Don't forget to check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5479</CAPACITOR> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> = 0v
measured it while charging, but I don't turn it on with smc bypass
continuity all good.., is the traces at pin 1of <CAPACITOR>C5749</CAPACITOR> which was gone the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
Check for short at <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>.
If yes, <CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5021</CAPACITOR> are the first suspects.
If no short, change <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
damn, sorry my brain isn't engaged, how could i forget to check short on 0v line,,
one of the caps is blown, replaced, and it boots normally now, thankss a lott!!
